page.title: 01BROADWELL: GAZETEER
page.content: In this rural area of the North Cotswolds, land falls from 190m-110m above sea level. The River Evenlode flows S.E. to the Thames following the valley which also provides the route for the London-Hereford railway. Most of the land is used for mixed farming. The villages of Broadwell & Oddington have houses for about 250 families. Both villages have parish churches. Broadwell, listed in the 1086 Domesday Book, has a village school. People create their own recreational activities. Family cars are necessary transport. There are few bus services. Many tourists visit this scenic area as customers of the Pottery, the Alpine Nursery, to order a hand- crafted chair or to visit the ancient church of St.Nicholas at Oddington.
